derivation.yuyuan_name: Urdu, via Persian from Arabic ṣāḥib 'friend, lord'

entry.tran: 先生，老爷，阁下，大人(印度人对有权人的尊称，尤指在英国统治时期对白人官员的称呼)
entry.def: Sahib is a term used by some people in India to address or to refer to a man in a position of authority. Sahib was used especially of white government officials in the period of British rule.

example.ex: 'It is most urgent, sahib,' he said.

example.tran: 英国的老爷们和太太们

means.word_mean: 1. formerly a term of respect for important white Europeans in colonial India; used after the name
